website_summaries.verdict: This strap is specifically designed for Olympus Stylus SW series digital cameras, but it works well with a variety of other waterproof devices.
pros: Intended for use with Olympus Stylus SW series digital cameras
Strap sits high in the water so it's easy to find
Works with many other types of waterproof cameras besides Olympus brand
cons: Strap can slide off small hands, but it floats, so just scoop it up out of the water

customer_reviews.title: It floats which more than I can say for other brands
customer_reviews.text: It holds up my iPhone 11pro in lifeproof case. It not cute and chic like others on amazon but it works which is what’s important here. Don’t care if my phone looks cute if it’s at the bottom of the ocean! This is perfect for snapping photos on my paddle board and not worrying if my pup or a wave knocks into me and my phone sinks.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren V

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I used this quite a bit with my Olympus TG-5 while snorkeling in the Caribbean, and Jet Skiing at the lake. It definitely floats the camera and it's easy to see. It doesn't really restrict your motion and it's easy on and off. It's also not too buoyant, so diving down doesn't cause any problems. It has this quick disconnect that they put there just so you could attach it to your camera, but now I wish the standard wrist strap on the camera had this quick connect too so that I could easily switch between. That's more an issue with the other strap though.
customer_reviews.author: Dave K

customer_reviews.title: Floats very well with my camera
customer_reviews.text: I had a strap just like this for my camera for 5 years. I needed to replace it bc the part the attaches to my camera was worn out. Yes, I did carry it by that handle frequently, but 5 years seems pretty good. I do have a 2nd strap now. It floats very well with my camera and I know I'll feel much better with this attached to my camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Nassoiy

customer_reviews.title: it's won't easily fall off a small hand
customer_reviews.text: Floats well (with Olympus TG4). Adjustment toggle for small hands - with the toggle all the way to the cuff, it's won't easily fall off a small hand. But beware, the knot came untied in the little loop of string that loops through the camera attachment, and the strap fell off. This after perhaps 10 days of use, and when I was trusting the strap and just letting the camera dangle from my wrist while swimming. Amazingly, it came apart on land, about 10 seconds after I came out of the water, and I didn't lose my camera and pictures...
customer_reviews.author: NDH

customer_reviews.title: You’ll Float Too!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my newly purchase Olympus Tough TG-5. It provided extra security as I took the camera into the ocean and on a couple of snorkeling trips. I did test that it would in fact float the camera if ever dropped and in fact it did. The quick connect clip is handy for popping this strap on and off the camera as needed. The strap fit easily over my large hand and the snap closer secured it nicely around my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: TJM

customer_reviews.title: Floaty camera lifesaver - must have for waterproof camera..
customer_reviews.text: Can't tell you how many times I've been glad this float was attached to my camera when dropping it around water. I live on the water and mine snorkels, kayaks and swims all over with me. I've even scuba dived with it on and it didn't mess with my buoyancy as it pulls under easily enough.
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Potato

customer_reviews.title: Not adjustable
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that the cuff is not adjustable, which is fairly obvious but I hadn't noticed it before ordering. I want one that I can secure to my wrist. The Olympus strap floats a GoPro but isn't very usable. Also, the small cord that connects to your device isn't very long so looping it around the camera is a chore. If you're looking for a float to secure to your wrist I wouldn't recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Worked well, but not a snug fit
customer_reviews.text: Liked that it floated, had a good snap in, but where you hd the strap near the camera to keep the float from coming off of the wrist (not a tight fit)—was at the clip in piece. I was nervous about accidentally unclipping the float from the camera—wish there was a cover for this connection or a secondary safety strap
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Kopacka

customer_reviews.title: bulky
customer_reviews.text: When I use this strap, I no longer have to worry about dropping my camera in the water. But it is so dang bulky it gets in the way constantly when I want to take pictures. I'll probably end up buying a thinner replacement.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: This float strap works just fine for our water camera. We tested it in the river and no problems. The only concern is attaching it to the camera. I haven't come up with a quick attach--unattach method. Glad I have it though.
customer_reviews.author: N. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Bob up to the surface, please!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to go along with the Nikon waterproof camera and came in handy. The strap fits great around the hand and camera never once floated away or grip lost due to ocean current tugging on the camera. Experimented by letting the camera get away from me and the strap just bobbed up to the surface right away with the RED color announcing loudly exactly where the camera was. Could not complain with the construction or the handy nature of having one of these strapped to your expensive camera.
customer_reviews.author: Miataki

customer_reviews.title: Strap is too big! Does not stay on your wrist!
customer_reviews.text: This strap does not cinch tightly on my wrist, and I'm not a skinny guy. I'm about 6 feet tall and weigh about 180-190 pounds (perhaps more) right now, so I'm certainly a decent sized person. Also, I am a musician with very large hands. Even with the cinch mechanism tightly cinched all the way down, I am able to slip this thing on and off my wrist without loosening the cinch mechanism. If I were wearing a wetsuit and gloves, this might be just the right size, but I'm just planning on going snorkeling in a short-sleeved wetsuit with no gloves. Also, a skinny person with wetsuit and gloves would still have a problem with this.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Fabris

customer_reviews.title: Does as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: There's not much you can say about this strap. It does easily attach to my Olympus TG6 and it does keep it afloat but beyond that, there's really not much to tell.
customer_reviews.author: Superior.Shores

customer_reviews.title: ... this for our Olympus tough camera and it works great. Over the years we have lost two of ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our Olympus tough camera and it works great. Over the years we have lost two of our Olympus Tough cameras in the water so we were determined not to lose a third one. They are great cameras and this strap does the job and allows them to float. We don't keep it on the camera all of the time, but we do put it on if we will be anywhere near water. Losing a camera in a lake is really frustrating... but it won't happen again with this float strap. It is of good quality and is light weight. It is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Craig and Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Works with Olympus Stylus Tough TG-2
customer_reviews.text: I bought this strap for my Olympus Stylus Tough TG 2, as I was going on a canoeing trip and didn't want to lose the camera. I tested this with some shallow water before going in, and it floated perfectly! I even tossed it into the water to simulate dropping it, and it floated right back to the surface. The adjustable strap is effectively useless, as having it set to the smallest size still sits loose on my larger-than-average wrist. It still worked fine for me, but someone with a small wrist might have trouble. Overall a very good product. I would buy this again and I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Saturos

customer_reviews.title: Floats with TG1
customer_reviews.text: Too many reviews say it doesn't float. Mine floats with a TG1 attached with half the float out of the water. The little plastic clip is stupid and weak and I don't trust it, but the camera comes with a nice substantial strap anyway so you don't have to trust it. I only attach the strap when I'm in the water, just leave the other half of the clip attached to the camera and attach or detach the float as needed. Mine came in an Olympus branded blow moulded package, but isn't branded on the float as others are. It might be real, it might be fake......it cost $10 and it floats. Who really cares? Get one.
customer_reviews.author: Wile E Coyote

customer_reviews.title: stylist, quality, functional product.
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a recent cruise vacation. Snorkeling was great. Underwater photos came out terrific. And thanks to this float, I didn't have to worry about dropping my camera and losing it. This allowed me to let my young kids shoot some video without worry. More fun for all. Red color is great for visibility, and also matches the red trim on the camera. Bonus cool factor. Seems well made. Good sticking, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Dracula

customer_reviews.title: saved me from losing my camera AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: I lost my 2nd waterproof camera when I dropped it in the lazy river. I didn't notice it was missing until later and even though I walked the whole river, I never found it. I thought to myself "if only it had floated instead of sunk". Voila, now my camera floats and the arm band is helpful for when I need to do something else with my hands. I got the best pictures on our latest tubing trip! I am a 5'7" woman, 175 lb and it fits easily around my bicep.
customer_reviews.author: William C Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Holds the Camera Up
customer_reviews.text: We bought the float strap for our Olympus TG-3 camera. Didn't want it to drop to the bottom of the ocean due to carelessness. It holds the TG-3 up very well. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Wish it came in wrist sizes or was more adjustable
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are normal sized adults and this is too large for both of our wrists. Have adapted it for use but it should come with that ability.
customer_reviews.author: BAC

customer_reviews.title: works for the tg1 tough olympus...
customer_reviews.text: i have tested this strap in the pool and it floats perfectly.... BUT... i have not tested it using the fisheye or teleconverter attached... i have both but i cant find the accesory adapter anywhere on the net... once i get the adapter i will test it and let you know... but it floats the camera alone very well... as with any device there will be limitations... i couldnt use it as an emergency floatation device, so you must test it with your camera and lens combination to see if it works.
customer_reviews.author: Carryit

customer_reviews.title: worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This was great to have attached to my point and shoot waterproof camera while I snorkeled. I tested it in about 5 foot ocean water before going out. It floated just fine when I let it go. I then pushed it under water about 4 feet and it floated right back up to the surface. The clasp was well made and I felt confident that even if my camera got away from me while I was snorkeling in deeper water, this would keep it afloat so I could retrieve it. It was a little cumbersome to use. Too short to use like a purse strap and to large to use on my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: K. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Handy strap
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these for use on camera and cellphone waterproof case. They are excellent!
customer_reviews.author: lady of the lake

customer_reviews.title: This held my iPhone 11 Max Pro up in the ocean and the bay
customer_reviews.text: This worked even better than anticipated. It keeps my phone dry and prevents it from drowning.
customer_reviews.author: Lovetolaugh

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our FujiFilm XP waterproof camera, and it works. We use our camera in the boat with our young children and didn't want it to fall to the bottom of the lake, so we bought this. I liked the red color, it is not as bright (and ugly) and the yellow and orange ones, but still easily visible in the water. It fits my arm (I weigh 130 pounds) and my husbands arm (he's 240). Some people complained that the quick release button on the strap is "too quick" but we don't have this issue with ours... This is a great product, buy it so you don't lose your camera in the bottom of the lake!
customer_reviews.author: Kellip05

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I gave this strap because its just a little too big to hold snugly around an average sized wrist. I had my wife sew velcro onto the black ends of the strap to help hold it tighter. While on a recent vacation, I was able to test the "float" capability with my Olympus TG2 and it held up the camera very well. There's no way it would have sunk with this strap attached. It would have been perfect if it was just a little more adjustable to pull tighter.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: It does float
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera strap for the new Tough camera I also purchase to go snorkeling on our trip to Belize. It does float with the camera, which is what it is supposed to do. I big downfall is that you must also use your regular camera strap on your wrist, this float strap is just way too big even when cinched. This float strap is merely good for keeping your camera from falling to the bottom of the ocean, not to hold it on your wrist while swimming, it just floats off.
customer_reviews.author: L. Aschoff

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on our snorkeling trip
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go with my Olympus Tough for a snorkeling trip. It fit on my camera along with my regular wrist strap. The clip that separates the wrist strap from the connecting part of the strap that goes on the camera is really solid. It was tough to take apart, which is good, because it means it stays together well. My only complaint is that I wish the black strap part that is adjustable was actually long enough to put my wrist through. I'd like to use that part as the wrist strap because it feels more secure when I was swimming.
customer_reviews.author: AHud

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Product for Olympic Tough Camera
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant about trying another floating strap for my Olympus Tough camera. It's a heavy camera. The last float I tried came in a two pack and even with BOTH straps on the camera, the straps hovered below the waterline. I attached this strap and tossed it into the pool (hooked to a dog leash, just in case) and it floated GREAT. Can't wait to use it when river fishing in Alaska next week! I highly recommend this float strap!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Product was as advertised. We use it as a safety net for our cell phone in a waterproof case.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth O'Rourke

customer_reviews.title: Funciona para pulsos grandes
customer_reviews.text: Já tinha comprado um destes e é muito funcional, porém estes que comprei agora vieram maiores e por isto ficam folgados em meu pulso, mesmo ajustados. O outro que tenho tem menos gomos na pulseira de maneira que o ajuste é perfeito. Acho que falta nas informações de venda as medidas para que o comprador possa verificar e comrpar de acordo com suas necessidades. No meu caso, comprei 2 ítens para meus filhos, então o problema é pior. Mas o produto funciona para o fim a que se destina.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo - Brasil

customer_reviews.title: Too Big but Floats Good!
customer_reviews.text: This does its job and floats well but it is too big for most women's or smaller wrists. It doesn't cinch down small enough and slides right off. We bought it to take our waterproof camera snorkeling. We tested this in freshwater(bathtub) and in a saltwater pool. Both times it held up the camera, but we still used caution and didn't let go of it out in the ocean. It was our back up in case we dropped the camera...we didn't feel brave enough to try it out and risk losing the camera in deep water.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Mills

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us
customer_reviews.text: This was too big and bulky and got in the way of swimming when snorkeling. If you need something to keep your camera (or anything) from getting lost in deep water, I think it would be very useful. I was going to use it on a white water rafting trip and they had me clip my camera to my life vest and tuck it in. They didn't want anything that had the potential of the camera hitting someone by swinging around going over rapids or falling out of the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Young

customer_reviews.title: Making waterproof camera more secure on kayak trips
customer_reviews.text: Plan to use on kayak trips with new Olympus camera......we aren't planning to float the camera as such, but will attach the float strap if camera is dropped in the water on trips or missed when tossed between kayaks to other people......maybe will try floating camera in shallow Michigan trout streams with us standing right by to see how that works too.....
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Safranek

customer_reviews.title: As others have noted the strap, even when cinched ...
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted the strap, even when cinched tight, is very large. I tend to push the strip up toward my elbow when I'm not using the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Sturzenacker

customer_reviews.title: Good safety for camera in water
customer_reviews.text: Works well to keep from losing camera in water, even just boating.
customer_reviews.author: Hal S. Beech

customer_reviews.title: Must have on water
customer_reviews.text: Really keeps the camera float, though plastic clip feels weak. But it did not fail.
customer_reviews.author: Denis Chernov

customer_reviews.title: An absolute necessity if using the camera in the ocean.
customer_reviews.text: I brought a new Olympus tg-2 with me when getting my scuba certification this past week in Antigua. I must say this float strap performed perfectly. I can think of a couple of times when it out-right saved the camera. The bright red is very visible in the blue water and it will keep the camera from dropping like a brick should it fall in. It stood up to all the abuse of a novice scuba diver, 17mph winds and surf, and got the camera back in one piece.
customer_reviews.author: robert kennymore

customer_reviews.title: Yes, you need it.
customer_reviews.text: Mosquito netting on my head and using this strap to keep the camera handy and netting close to the back of my neck. Despite the comfort of a padded strap and no biting insects around my head while on a canoe trip I knocked the camera off into some rapids, just once. So I needed the strap just once and that's enough, it paid for itself for saving the memories on the flash card in the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Lauri J.

customer_reviews.title: Saved my camera
customer_reviews.text: My Olympus waterproof camera fell out of my pocket when I slipped at the boat launch today and "Plop" it went into the water. The foam strap kept it afloat and out of the muck.
customer_reviews.author: FormerBuckeye

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought!
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box, this is much smaller than I expected so I was wondering if it would be enough to keep my camera afloat and it is! I lost a waterproof camera once so when I got a new camera, I didn't want to lose another. This is a perfect solution.
customer_reviews.author: Let's be honest...

customer_reviews.title: It broke after one week.
customer_reviews.text: I used the product for a week on my waterproof camera and the strap broke. Nearly lost my camera. They have been much more durable in the past. I ordered two, so I will use the second one cautiously.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L. Kessler

customer_reviews.title: Floating camera strap... SHOCKER, it works!
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews talked about this being too big for the wrist, it is a bigger strap, but it needs to be in order to do its job. It attaches to my camera. It floats with the camera (Olympus TG-830 iHS) attached. Job done. 5 star rating. Served its purpose very well snorkeling on the backside of Molokini in 200+ feet of water as well as every other place I snorkeled with it.
customer_reviews.author: Knight511

customer_reviews.title: Misleading advertising...
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed when it came and didn't have the Olympus logo (as advertised) on it. I could have paid less without the logo on another site. However, it does work well in our pool. Haven't been to the ocean with it but since it floats well in "fresh" water, it shouldn't be a problem in salt water. Like others have stated, it fits really large on the wrist and you will probably have to push it up your arm.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Long

customer_reviews.title: Great floating strap!
customer_reviews.text: I have had an Olympus tough camera for some time but I never had a floating strap on it. I recently bought a cheap one from a big box store. My camera didn't float at all with it! I returned it and decided to invest in the much better Olympus strap. This one works perfect! I dropped my camera while jet skiing in lake Erie and it was very easy to spot floating in the water! Highly reccomended this strap!
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Great flotation strap
customer_reviews.text: We have used this strap in salt and fresh water situations and it has saved our camera several times. It is sized large enough that it can support a fairly sizeable camera. The padded portion is generally too large to actually cinch down on your wrist. However we only bought it for the flotation and still use the strap on the camera itself. Test it in a pool first to make sure that it will float your camera!
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Chinese Counterfit Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: This item is a chinese counterfit. Not the original item from olympus! The quality is also highly inferior to the real product from olympus. The stitching on the real product is of a high quality and will withstand abuse but when I look at the stitching product of this item it deteriorated quickly.
customer_reviews.author: nathan

customer_reviews.title: Worked with the TG-5 but...
customer_reviews.text: I question the strength and durability of the thin string holding the float to the camera. I kept the TG-5’s standard wrist strap around my wrist too just in case.
customer_reviews.author: MTChas

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Bulky, but totally worth it! We switched this strap back and forth with our regular one on our trip to Hawaii. Took my "tough" camera into the ocean, and went on a boat ride with it. Checked beforehand to make sure it floated in sink, and worked great! Never dropped it in ocean, but felt secure n didn't have to worry wether I might!
customer_reviews.author: S. Poetter

customer_reviews.title: works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sucker to go with the olympus stylus tg-830 digital camera. We were going on a boating trip in Jamaica and i wanted to be sure i could find the camera if i let go of it in the water while snorkeling. The product was as advertised and did the trick! a must for any camera you plan on taking into the water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, good price
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful little camera. Cautious experiments suggest that it is indeed shock-resistant (I confess to messing with friends' heads by "accidentally" dropping it while handing it to them for examination). I've not yet checked out the waterproof quality, but the seals seem well-engineered. Picture quality and controls seem superb. Full mastery may be a chore -- the manual (Software-only accompanies the camera. I purchased a bound copy from Canon for $10.) outweighs the camera. I purchased the case & float as part of a package with the camera -- they are perfectly adequate and a bargain in the package deal.
customer_reviews.author: rush elkins

customer_reviews.title: This is not the old heavy duty Olympus 5 section strap.
customer_reviews.text: This is not the same Olympus float strap I purchased 3 years ago. The old one was a 5 segment strap and was about 25% thicker. This is only three segments but looks like 5 because the center one is creased in two places. It will work for lighter weight cameras but I would use it for one of the heavier point and shoot water proofs like a Nikon 130.
customer_reviews.author: ron schwarz

customer_reviews.title: Great "insurance" for your expensive underwater camera!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely buy this to keep your camera from sinking. Took this with our Olympis bora bora for a week and we were that "smart couple" who didn't lose their expensive underwater camera in the deep ocean. There were others who didn't have one and lost their cameras on the first day :(.
customer_reviews.author: A. S.

customer_reviews.title: It like a life jacket for your camera - kinda bulky
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly convienent for travel. I thought the inflatable part was collapsable but it is not. It like a life jacket for your camera - kinda bulky. I'm sure it works great but it's bascially just adding weight and size to our camera. Also, the strap is non adjustable and is WAY to big for my hand.
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Essential item for taking your waterproof camera into the surf.
customer_reviews.text: Adequate to float a TG4 or similar camera. Have not had it long enough to determine durability but seems strong enough. Should come with the camera if you don't want to easily lose one in the surf, as it will sink like a rock otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Technut Biker

customer_reviews.title: big, big strap
customer_reviews.text: This is not a strap that you keep on your camera all the time. It is big enough that you'll only want to have it when you are worried about losing your camera to the drink. But the size should have plenty of bouyancy--which is what it is made for, and it appears that it should hold up well to the summer sun, and the pool / river water.
customer_reviews.author: jobew

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Best quality and highest rated weight capacity of all the camera floats AMAZON offers. At a surprisingly low price.
customer_reviews.author: ceebcal

customer_reviews.title: String broke and camera at the bottom of the river
customer_reviews.text: Bought a new Olympus Tough camera and this float strap. Took it on a river raft trip in Tennessee. The small string part that connects to the camera broke and my brand new camera is at the bottom of the Pigeon river. The strap floats, but the string is weak!
customer_reviews.author: TanyaB

customer_reviews.title: A must have accessory to any non floating waterproof camera
customer_reviews.text: Functions exactly as I wanted. This takes the worry out of taking your waterproof camera into the ocean. Mine has survived many trips to the beach and when you want to pass the camera to your significant other, you can just throw in the water near them, It will float instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Camera floating.
customer_reviews.text: Used for underwater camera on honeymoon. Great to use. The clip that allows you to take off from the body is difficult to do. When we were no in the water, we would use our camera and it because real difficult for us to to detach the red part.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these over the years. They have held up nicely on family vacations, water parks and more.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Jenni

customer_reviews.title: Floaty works great in the ocean!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap strap string fell apart. Floaty works great in the ocean!
customer_reviews.author: SanJoseDad

customer_reviews.title: If you spend any time on the water, a good investment.
customer_reviews.text: I own several of these types of float lanyards. Some are good, some are worthless. The bad ones will detach at the clip with the slightest of tugs sending you camera to the bottom. Watch out for those. This one is not one of them. The clip on this one holds strong.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Christian

customer_reviews.title: Great floater
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, easy to see. Put the snap catch on the camera loop. You just click it in and go. I keep my thin non floating one attached as well so I don't have the bulkier floater when I'm high and dry. It's a great product. It certainly beats watching your new camera sinking into deep water.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Floats with Olympus Stylus Tough 8010
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this float with the Olympus stylus tough 8010. I tested the float with my camera attached in our pool and it did float. I purchased this particular float because it was recommended for my camera by Olympus. In all, it's a great idea and I'll give it a thorough test in the Caribbean this upcoming week!
customer_reviews.author: Janine

customer_reviews.title: Not at all like the picture
customer_reviews.text: Not at all like the picture. Only four section float, not five like in the picture. Does not say Olympus on the strap. I would not be surprised to learn this was a counterfeit. I didn't return it because it does work. I just wouldn't bother to buy one again.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Good strap, just watch the quick connect clip.
customer_reviews.text: This strap floated my Olympus TG-3 with battery and card in place. The quick release clip is a nice idea, but a little fussy when clicking the 2 pieces together. Be sure they are solidly mated by pulling on the cord to see if they separate. Using a caribiner clip from the camera strap to the float strap is better option so you don't accidentally lose the camera in the water. I found the arm strap to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Matlock

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The strap is way to wide to use on the wrist. A mans hand slips easily through. I was afraid to use it snorkeling in the sea.
customer_reviews.author: Schulz, Torsten

customer_reviews.title: Floats but falls off my wrist!
customer_reviews.text: This can float My Olympus TG-3, however it is so big around my wrist, it slips off while I am snorkeling. That really is NOT ideal. I will be looking for another.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does work!
customer_reviews.text: This strap provides enough buoyancy to keep a Olympus TG series camera afloat in both fresh and salt water. It's not so large to get in the way when snorkeling and diving and the buoyancy is not great enough to cause difficulty diving under water when you want to.
customer_reviews.author: Dane

customer_reviews.title: Great for my Olympus camera!
customer_reviews.text: Great for my Olympus camera! I was always scared I would drop it i while taking pics. in the water and now I don't have to worry!!!
customer_reviews.author: holreading

customer_reviews.title: Awesome floating strap!
customer_reviews.text: I currently have Olympus 1030SW digital and always had to keep the strap that came with the camera around my wrist when I would go under the water. Now that I have this floating strap all my worries that it would sink all the way to the bottom are gone. Very easy to locate (Red Color) and retrieve if the floating strap with camera got away. I would give it a 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: J. Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for waterproof cameras
customer_reviews.text: Great product for waterproof cameras! You will never have your camera fall. Very handy for carrying and of course floating. :D Very happy with pruchase
customer_reviews.author: Y. Torres

customer_reviews.title: I didn't really test it.
customer_reviews.text: I got this matching red foam float strap for my red Olympus Stylus TG-830 and red case Tamrac 3814. I was paying more to see Olympus print on the outside strap like the photo but when I got it, it is blank only said made in China inside. I was little disappointed. I could have pay few dollars less for other brand.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ling-Torres

customer_reviews.title: Haven't Had to Use It Yet, Thank God
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after I bought a water proof case. I realized that a dry phone on the bottom of the ocean didn't do us any good. I am glad to report that I have not had to use this yet but I am glad that if an issue does occur that the phone will float so that we can retrieve it.
customer_reviews.author: Nomore MS

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my 1030SW floating just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I used this item in conjunction with my 1030SW olympus camera all summer. A must have for a waterproof camera. I mean really whats the point of having a waterproof camera that sinks strait to the bottom. Also like the quick disconnect so you don't have to look goofy when not on the water. May not snug up enough for those with dainty wrists but that's why I left both straps on.
customer_reviews.author: William Matsumoto

customer_reviews.title: Great idea
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine, have taken it to several island trips, waterfalls, snorkeling, SUPing and no problems. If you do drop it, it's easy to find. That being said, I've never lost the camera or had to frantically search, so I'm not sure how long this would stay floating.
customer_reviews.author: micah brady

customer_reviews.title: It Floats!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a trip out on a river. It works great and it floats my Olympus camera no problems. -1 star because its too large to put tightly on my wrist.... and too small to use around my neck for a floating lanyard. Regardless, as long as my camera isn't at the bottom of the ocean I'm good!
customer_reviews.author: Gideon

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought an underwater camera to use at the lake. I was a little nervous about losing it because we throw the camera back and forth to each other to take pictures. This holds the camera (a canon) up with no problems, and I have no more worries of losing my camera to the bottom of the lake!!
customer_reviews.author: Jo R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Item for TG-4
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, took this snorkeling with me during my last vacation for TG-4. If you do anything in or around water you want this.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne AutumnTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: I got this for my Olympus TG-830, has been ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Olympus TG-830, has been really handy to use in the sea, the river and the pool! You can throw the camera around with no problem. Red color really stands out in case it drifts away.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: It needs to be able to do 2 things
customer_reviews.text: ...and it does. It floats, and it is a strap, and as a bonus, it's easy to remove when you want. a little bulky, but it has to have enough bulk to float. Kind of works as a guard for your camera if you put the camera into it and then in your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps your camera floating. It's easy to spot if your camera swims away. I wouldn't go in the water without it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wenzler

customer_reviews.title: A must have when snorkeling and taking pictures underwater.
customer_reviews.text: Peace of mind when using my Olympus tg-4 underwater camera. I could even let go of it when I need both hands and the camera just floats.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Drop your camra in the ocean, with this it'l float
customer_reviews.text: With my Cannon TG-3 attached it floated for hours with us in the ocean at the beach. I carried this camera and floating strap around for 8 days at the resort with out complaint.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: floating strap
customer_reviews.text: we have not tried it yet to see if it will float the camera but I like the way it connects easy and is comfortable to wear. we will use this camera a lot in the water so it will be something we must have to make sure we do not loose it in the rivers or ocean.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Foam Float Strap
customer_reviews.text: If you have a waterproof camera, you absolutely NEED this strap! Very handy if you happen to drop your waterproof camera in the water. It keeps the camera from sinking and makes it so easy to retrieve if you're fishing, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great! now I cant loose my camera at the lake
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: TESTED IN KEY WEST
customer_reviews.text: This little floatation device really works. a must have for your on the go camera. Well made. . The camera clip at the end makes it easily detachable when going from sea to land mode. I use a cararbiner and attached it to the strap to my vest with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: George A. Blesso III

customer_reviews.title: So I love it!
customer_reviews.text: It floats and keeps my camera from sinking! So I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick F McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my camera close at hand!
customer_reviews.text: This strap works great on my camera. the quick release makes it easy to take the strap off when I am not in the water. If you "drop" the camera while under water, the strap will bring it right back up to the surface and is bright enough to easily find...
customer_reviews.author: K. Stigler

customer_reviews.title: Foam carry strap
customer_reviews.text: OK - you've got that new tough, waterproof point & shoot. Now you know it will sink, right? A tether cord to your belt is a good way to go, but so is a foam strap. This one is as good as any out there and its $10 bucks Prime.
customer_reviews.author: HutchyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good for low speed situations. Strap ripped while tubing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my Olympus TG-2. Worked well for swimming around and diving off a dock. Camera floated just fine and easy to see. Then I went tubing and had the strap around my wrist with the camera in my hand. I got thrown off the tube and when I came up, the camera was still in my hand and the strap was on my wrist but the thin cord part attached to the camera had ripped. I was planning to use this camera while bridge jumping but now I have to either buy a tougher strap or improve this one.
customer_reviews.author: SxLx

customer_reviews.title: Does more than just keep your camera afloat
customer_reviews.text: Bot this along with a new waterproof digital camera to take whitewater rafting in the Grand Canyon and didn't actually have to use it for the purpose intended (keeping camera afloat in case it falls in the water.) Never had to use it that way because every time we hit the biggest rapids, I used the adjustable tab on it to secure the camera completely around my arm, so it never left my body. Others in my group were quite impressed and asked where to buy one for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Bregenzer

customer_reviews.title: Just Right !
customer_reviews.text: This floating strap worked perfectly. It floated the camera but did not interfere with taking it underwater. There was no feeling of being pulled up by the float. Just right!
customer_reviews.author: LPearson

customer_reviews.title: Worked great with my camera
customer_reviews.text: I used this with my TG-2 while diving at a reef in Mexico. When we first went in I had not fastened the loop tight enough to my wrist. The camera floated to the top. It was comfortable to wear. Plan on using this again in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: love it. this is our second one
customer_reviews.text: love it. this is our second one. the clip broke on our first one that we had had for about 4-5 yrs.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Pecenka

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on and take off the camera
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my new TG-4 camera. Works great. Keeps the camera afloat, easy to take off and put back on.
customer_reviews.author: Cemile Guldal

customer_reviews.title: This was great for our snorkeling trip
customer_reviews.text: This was great for our snorkeling trip. Thankfully we didn't need it to float with the camera attached but it would have been perfect if we did. It fit comfortably on the wrist while snorkeling. It is nice that it has the clip so it is easy to pop off for when we were out of the water.
customer_reviews.author: erin jonas

customer_reviews.title: Works great on Olympus TG-2
customer_reviews.text: keeps my Olympus TG2 afloat perfectly. when thrown in the pool or ocean with the strap on, it surfaces almost immediately. I like the quick release snap/clip too. This way, I can leave the tether on the camera and quickly attach the float strap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Olympus Foam Float Strap, 202212, Red
product_meta.description: Float strap for Olympus TG- series cameras. Red
feature_bullets: For the Olympus Stylus SW series digital cameras
Bright colored strap sits high in the water making it easy to spot
